alert.note: Alert for Guernsey; Muskingum; Noble (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 9:08PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN GUERNSEY... SOUTHEASTERN MUSKINGUM AND NORTHWESTERN NOBLE COUNTIES THROUGH 945 PM EDT... At 908 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of New Concord, or 8 miles east of Zanesville, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Cambridge, New Concord, Byesville, Philo, Pleasant Grove, Senecaville, Pleasant City, Cumberland, Lore City, Old Washington, Sarahsville, and Norwich. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Ohio between mile markers 157 and 190. Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 31 and 48. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for east central Ohio.
